se.cbb.jprime.math

Class RealInterval

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.cbb.jprime.math.RealInterval

  • public class RealInterval
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a 1-D real valued interval of the type [a,b), (a,b], (-inf,inf), etc.
    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RealInterval

        public RealInterval(double a,
            double b,
            boolean isLeftOpen,
            boolean isRightOpen)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        a - lower bound, possibly Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY.
        b - upper bound, possibly Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY.
        isLeftOpen - true if lower bound is not itself valid, e.g. (a,b].
        isRightOpen - true if upper bound is not itself valid, e.g. [a,b).

      • RealInterval

        public RealInterval()
        Constructor. Creates an unbounded interval.

        public boolean isWithin(double value)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if within; false if outside.

      • getRandom

        public double getRandom(java.util.Random rng)
        Returns a random double uniformly drawn from this interval. Not extensively tested, and with several theoretic idiosyncrasies:
        • Cases where the span (b-a) > Double.MAX_VALUE are not supported. This goes for some similar cases as well, e.g., (a,inf) for finite a < 0.
        • For [a,b], endpoints will be returned half as often as any other number.
        • For (-inf,inf), 0 will be returned twice as often as any other number.
        Parameters:
        rng - a (possibly pseudo) random number generator.
        Returns:
        a random double drawn using rng.

      • getWidth

        public double getWidth()
        Returns b-a.
        Returns:
        the width.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
